summary: Jeremy Ray Akers is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents detail his presence on the committee's staff, his position, annual salary, and gross pay for specific accounting periods. The documents suggest he was a consistent member of the HSCA staff during the period covered by these records.
significance: Jeremy Ray Akers' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role isn't detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll and certification reports indicates he was part of the team involved in the investigation. Further research would be needed to determine the extent of his contribution to the HSCA's work.
